alert.note: Alert for Magoffin (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 7:48AM EST until February 17 at 5:00PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Licking River near Salyersville affecting Magoffin County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Licking River near Salyersville. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Low lying areas flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM EST Friday the stage was 17.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is nearing a crest around 17.3. The river should fall below flood stage by early this afternoon. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.4 feet on 01/08/1953. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The next statement will be issued 3 PM EST.
